page.title: 10A CHILD LOOKS AT ULLAPOOL.
page.content: The landscape in and around Ullapool is very beautiful indeed and Loch Broom is pretty and usually calm but can be rough and extremely fierce when there is a storm. There is not much flat land around Ullapool, only that by the sea and by the banks of the river. Surrounding Ullapool are hills,rough- grazing, fields,forests,rivers and mountains. The hills are covered with heather, brown in winter and deep purple in late summer. On clear,still,sunny days the hills are reflected in the waters of the loch. In winter the river sometimes freezes over and in some places the ice is strong enough for ice-skating.In summer it is sometimes warm enough to swim in.
